prior_works.title: Semantic Scene Completion from a Single Depth Image (SSCNet)
prior_works.authors: Shuran Song, Fisher Yu, Andy Zeng, Angel X. Chang, Manolis Savva, Thomas Funkhouser
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Established SSC as voxel-wise semantic segmentation with dense voxel labels, defining the dominant paradigm that VoxDet explicitly rethinks into an instance-centric, detection-style formulation.

prior_works.title: Panoptic-DeepLab: A Simple, Strong, and Fast Baseline for Bottom-Up Panoptic Segmentation
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Introduced center heatmaps and per-pixel offset regression targets derived from labels, directly inspiring VoxDet’s use of offset fields and the VoxNT conversion of labels into instance-centric offset supervision.

prior_works.title: CenterNet: Objects as Points
prior_works.authors: Xingyi Zhou, Dequan Wang, Philipp Krähenbühl
prior_works.role: Anchor-free dense detection via center keypoints and offsets
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Demonstrated that dense detection can be decoupled into center localization plus regression, a design mirrored by VoxDet when casting voxel-level SSC as dense object detection with offset regression and semantic prediction.

prior_works.title: CenterPoint: Center-based 3D Object Detection and Tracking
prior_works.authors: Tianwei Yin, Xingyi Zhou, Philipp Krähenbühl
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Showed the effectiveness of center heatmaps and offset regression in 3D, supporting VoxDet’s instance-centric reformulation of 3D SSC as dense detection on voxel grids.

prior_works.title: VoteNet: A Deep Learning Labeling Paradigm for 3D Object Detection from Point Clouds
prior_works.authors: Charles R. Qi, Or Litany, Kaiming He, Leonidas J. Guibas
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Popularized learning offsets from points to object centers for 3D grouping/detection, conceptually underpinning VoxDet’s offset regression targets derived via the VoxNT label conversion.

prior_works.title: VoxelNet: End-to-End Learning for Point Cloud Based 3D Object Detection
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Provided the end-to-end voxel feature learning paradigm that enables dense 3D prediction on voxel grids, the spatial substrate used by VoxDet’s dense detection formulation.

prior_works.title: ImVoxelNet: Image-to-Voxel 3D Object Detection
prior_works.authors: Ilya Rukhovich, Anna Vorontsova, Anton Konushin
prior_works.role: Dense detection in voxel space from images
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Demonstrated effective dense detection directly in voxel representations, informing VoxDet’s choice to operate instance-centrically within a voxel grid for SSC.

synthesis_narrative:
VoxDet’s key contribution is to recast Semantic Scene Completion (SSC) from voxel-wise semantic segmentation into an instance-centric, dense detection problem, supervised by offset fields derived from standard SSC labels. SSCNet established the community’s default formulation—per-voxel semantic classification with dense voxel labels—whose limitations (instance fragmentation and ambiguity) VoxDet targets. Two strands of prior work directly shape VoxDet’s redesign.
First, offset-based instance representations showed how simple supervision can yield strong instance discriminability. Panoptic-DeepLab’s center heatmaps with per-pixel offsets defined a generic way to turn label masks into instance-aware regression targets; VoteNet extended the idea to 3D, using point-to-center voting for grouping and detection. These works motivate VoxDet’s Voxel-to-Instance (VoxNT) trick, which converts voxel-level labels into instance-level offset supervision without extra annotation.
Second, dense and center-based object detection provides the architectural lens for SSC. CenterNet demonstrated anchor-free decoupling of classification from center/offset regression, later proven highly effective in 3D by CenterPoint. Operating within voxel grids is supported by VoxelNet’s end-to-end voxel feature learning, while ImVoxelNet shows dense detection directly in voxel space. Synthesizing these insights, VoxDet treats SSC as dense voxel detection: semantic prediction paired with offset regression to implicit instance centers, resolving the instance-level incompleteness and adjacency ambiguities inherent to segmentation-style SSC.
